title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Edges Up to 102.37
items.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was little changed, edging up 0.04% to 102.37. The index was up in the past 13 trading sessions.

items.title: Jump Trading Raked In Crypto Profits. Now It's Paying a $123 Million Penalty.
items.description: Regulators fine a unit of the high-speed trading firm over its dealings with disgraced crypto tycoon Do Kwon.

items.title: The Fee We're Paying for Stolen Packages
items.description: Retailers are charging a few extra dollars on orders to protect customers against lost and stolen packages.

items.title: ‘I keep hearing about break-ins in my neighborhood’: Should I keep valuable items in a safe-deposit box? What are my options?
items.description: “I read that the bank discourages people from storing jewelry and coins in the boxes, so I did not rent one.”

items.title: ‘I’ve always been very good with money’: Should I put my wife on the title of my home, investment property and my late father’s house?
items.description: “If I die and she sells the properties, would she have to pay a lot of capital-gains taxes, especially on the houses we don’t live in?”

items.title: Elite Colleges Have a Looming Money Problem
items.description: Trump policies and high costs could make coming years a financial challenge for Harvard and other Ivy League universities.

items.title: My friend has a dependent son, 32, who drives without car insurance. Would his parents be criminally liable if he has an accident?
items.description: “They declare him as a dependent for tax purposes.”

items.title: The Bank Behind the Fintech Revolution Stumbles After Customer Funds Go Missing
items.description: Evolve Bank at its peak managed around $10 billion for financial technology firms, but it is in turmoil following the collapse of middleman Synapse.

items.title: ‘She has two financially stable children’: Does it make sense for my wealthy mother, a recent widow, to take out a $100,000 life-insurance policy?
items.description: “It was generous of our mom to offer.”

items.title: The Mega Millions jackpot is now $1.15 billion, but that’s not the only thing fueling December lottery sales
items.description: Scratch-off games are also popular during the holiday season
